intro: Ophiorrhiza huanjiangensis, commonly known as the Huanjiang hibiscus, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Ophiorrhiza huanjiangensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas.
